alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:27AM EST until December 20 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Penobscot River At Eddington affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River is out of banks in several areas with high flows. Residents along the river should prepare for flooding if additional rises are expected. At 20.0 feet, High flows on the Penobscot River cause backwater effects upon several streams and creeks resulting in lowland flooding between Greenbush and Milford. Properties along the Penobscot River could have impacts on outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - At 16.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 19.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.7 feet on 12/23/1973. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM EST.
